title: What country was the first to be invaded by Nazi Germany in World War I? - Quora

response.answer_text: You’ll need to rephrase your question. Did you mean World War 2, or did you mean Imperial Germany in World War 1? World War 1 was 1914–1918, and Nazi Germany didn’t exist until 1933. Here’s the answers to both. 1914, Imperial Germany first invaded Belgium, attacking the city of Liege. The Austro-Hungarian empire had already invaded Serbia. German plans were to knock out the French quickly, then fight the Russians. 1938, Nazi Germany invaded Czechoslovakia despite promising after the Munich agreement that it would not do so. Britain and France warned Germany that if any further invasions happened, war would be declared. Germany invaded Poland September 1,1939, triggering the start of World War 2 in Europe

The German Imperial Army occupied Luxembourg on Sunday 2 August 1914. Some cavalry units were given orders prematurely and crossed the borders into France and Belgium also on the 2 August but the order for the invasion for Belgium was not issued until the next day. Although the Imperial Army had a number of men who would become Nazi’s after the Great War the Nazi party had not been created in 1914.
